p.s: Following I am going to comment on Walter's and the other Youngers' dreams in the context of the American Dream and African American History.
The statement of Mama Lena that Walter has almost lost his mind thinking about money all the time is in my opinion true because he only thinks about the check all the time but it is not his money.
His dream of a liquor store with his friends is only valuable if he gets seventy five thousand dollar from his mother.
When the mother gives him the money the other dreams of the other family membermembers aren't more realizable.
In my opinion is a liquor store a stupid idea because with liquor you can destroy other lifeslives and that's not good.
On the other side is WaltersWalter's dream a dream which shows a little bit the American Dream.
The American Dream is an idea that wealth can be gained by hard and deligent work no matter from where you are.
This setting is to find in Walter because he don'tdoesn't want that his child sleeps in the living room and that he telltells him stories about how rich white people are (cf. l. 41f.).
Beneatha's dream shows also the American Dream because she wants to become a doctor.
Black women were in this time not respected and she wants to become a doctor that shows that she has a strong personality.
The other'sothers' dreams are also long term dreams because the house would be in the future a house too.
In my opinion are all dreams an example for the American Dream and reflect the American Dream because Walter wants to become rich as a black person from his job as a chauffeur.
Beneatha wants to become a doctor as a black women and this shows in my opinion the American Dream the best.
Mama Lena thinks that it is not good for Walter to think the whole time about money but in my opinion it is good because why not.
Money is necessary for all people on the world.
You can say that you don't have to think the whole time about it but sometimes you need to think about.

In conclusion you can say that the American Dream and African American history hashave an impact on the family esspeciallyespecially on Walter because he thinks about the future and wantwants to change something that the family could live in better living conditions.
